name: probability
doc: If the cells are selected this is the percentage chance the reaction occurs. This can have up to 2 decimal places, further precision does nothing.

name: input_cell1
doc: The first cell in the reaction. Can be a tag `[tag_name]` or a cell `cell_name`

name: output_cell1
doc: The material input_cell1 is converted to. Can be a tag `[tag_name]` or a cell `cell_name`. If this is a tag and the tag is not in the inputs a random material that has the tag will be produced.

name: input_cell2
doc: The second cell in the reaction. Can be a tag `[tag_name]` or a cell `cell_name`

name: output_cell2
doc: The material input_cell2 is converted to. Can be a tag `[tag_name]` or a cell `cell_name`. If this is a tag and the tag is not in the inputs a random material that has the tag will be produced.

name: input_cell3
doc: If this is empty its a 2 cell reaction, if it's not then it's a 3 cell reaction, and output_cell3 must be set. Can be a tag `[tag_name]` or a cell `cell_name`

name: output_cell3
doc: If this is empty its a 2 cell reaction, if it's not then it's a 3 cell reaction, and input_cell3 must be set. Can be a tag `[tag_name]` or a cell `cell_name`. If this is a tag and the tag is not in the inputs a random material that has the tag will be produced.

name: req_lifetime
doc: Only do the reaction if input_cell1 has lived longer than this. Can be a tag `[tag_name]` or a cell `cell_name`

name: blob_radius1
doc: Radius of pixels of input_cell1 to react

name: blob_radius2
doc: Radius of pixels of input_cell1 to react

name: direction
doc: Only do the reaction if input_cell2 is in this direction from input_cell2

name: convert_all
doc: If true floodfills the connected region of each input cell type and converts them to their respective output

name: entity
doc: Loads this entity at the reaction coords when it happens
